The best description of the available calculations and features of the code can be found where the code is stored - a first, brief description is available as hep-ph/0609285

The basic concept of fastNLO has been described in talks given at various occasions:

The most recent developements are documented here:


- in: Tevatron-for-LHC Report of the QCD Working Group: hep-ph/0609285
- 2nd HERA - LHC Workshop, April 2006, CERN (soon)
- DIS 2006 Workshop, April 2006, Tsukuba, Japan (slides, proceedings)
Earlier talks about work in progress:


- TeV4LHC meeting in April 2005 at CERN (slides)
- Frontiers of Contemporary Physics, Nashville, TN, May 2005 (slides)
- TeV4LHC meeting in October 2005 at FNAL (slides)

fastNLO Figures:


- inclusive jet data in different processes at different energies (.png and .eps)


A publication is currently in preparation - in the meantime please cite hep-ph/0609285
A detailed user manual will be provided soon.



Thomas Kluge, Klaus Rabbertz, Markus Wobisch
(send mail to the authors: fastnlo@cedar.ac.uk)
